msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

The interaction of the 'text' and 'content' properties is now working as intended. If you set one and wait for the updateComplete event, you can now get the other. (In the meantime, the other is null.) If you set both at the same time, 'content' wins.
Also, setting the 'text' or the 'content' of a TextView now causes the selection range to be reset to (-1, -1), which means "no selection".
QA: Please test the interaction of the 'text' and 'content' properties in TextGraphic, TextView, and TextArea.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
TextGraphic and TextView now use TCAL_FORMAT rather than FXG_FORMAT when importing a text string, so that all TCAL formats are recognized rather than just FXG ones.
Also, each class now maintains an importer object in a static var rather than creating one each time text needs to be imported.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

TextGraphic and TextView now keep track of which TCAL formatting styles were specified on them vs. which formats were specified on their TextFlow. They do this by using the hostCharacterFormat, hostParagraphFormat, and hostContainerFormat properties of their TextFlow to store the host component's formats. Previously, both sets of formats were combined into the TextFlow's characterFormat, paragraphFormat, and containerFormat objects.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
TextInput and TextArea now participate in the FocusManager's tab ring. For example, you can tab to an empty TextInput and start entering text.

The selectionAnchorPosition and selectionActivePosition properties of TextView, TextInput, and TextArea are now read-only, in accordance with the spec for these components. You must use the setSelection() method to set the selection.
QA: Please remove any tests where you set selectionAnchorPosition or selectionActivePosition.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

For compatibility reasons it was decided that the new functionality remain integrated with the old framework, although we will continue to build two separate SWCs, one with primarily existing framework classes, and one with new Flex 4 classes. This change removes duplicate names from the Flex 4 framework to avoid class name overlapping with the old framework code.  The naming overlap consists of two major areas:  New Components, and New Effects
